alert.note: Alert for Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Routt County through 600 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Steamboat Springs to near Oak Creek to near Yampa. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oak Creek around 540 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Steamboat Springs. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 135 and 151. Colorado 131 between mile markers 45 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin
